185945717.review: So I just finished What Remains of Edith Finch. I hadn't realized I had seen some of this gameplay before.  This game is stunning and was created by the development team at Giant Sparrow.  This game originally came out in 2017 and the graphics and design are great.  This story-telling game has you, Edith Finch, the last of your family, going through your family history.  At 22 weeks pregnant you want to write down the history for your soon-to-be newborn to reflect on when they get older.  You play as some of the family remembers as you retell their lives and unfortunately how they passed.  You are the last Finch for a reason.  Unsure of family curse or just bad luck the absolute tragedy of this family will leave you in tears again and again.  The detail in every room as you go through the house is phenomenal you can really get a sense of each character and their character development.  I highly recommend this game, along with tissues, as a one-time sit down and play through title.  Also totally get an achievement for only having to swoop down twice as an owl to hunt rabbits. highly recommend

185875529.review:
Hikaye sunuş şekli açısından oynadığım en kaliteli işlerden biri olduğunu söyleyebilirim. Finch ailesindeki üyelerin birbirinden trajik ve derin hikayelerini deneyimliyorsunuz. Olayların içine girdikçe her karakterin psikolojik derinliklerine inip içsel duygularına ortak oluyorsunuz. Kimi hikaye diğerlerine oranla daha normal gelirken bazıları da ise fazlasıyla üzücü ve sarsıcı. Oyun, bu hikayeleri farklı tarzlarla bize yaşattırıyor ve her birinin bir parçası olmak oyuncuyu daha da etkiliyor. Bu açıdan üstüne fazlasıyla düşünülmüş ve özgün bir iş çıkmış diyebilirim.

What Remains of Edith Finch, kısa süresine rağmen farklılıkları ile öne çıkan ve bunlarda fazlasıyla başarılı olan bir yürüme simülasyonu olmuş. Boş vaktiniz var ise ve tek oturuşta bitirmek isteyeceğiniz kaliteli bir yapım arıyorsanız tam size göre.

185865671.review:
慎重！慎重！如果你是听说这游戏是剧情神作，第九艺术，想买来自己亲自玩一下，我的建议是别买了，该作品只适合云玩，作为一个游戏，是极其不成功的。

我玩不下去，我也不想去找什么剧情解析，作为一个游戏，它是真的失败。说一下几个缺点：

步行模拟器，但是第一人称，我一个不晕3d的人，玩这个游戏感觉非常不舒服，这个视角很畸形。

毫无引导，一点提示都没有，包括操作上的。打开一个笔记本或者一个别的东西要鼠标加键盘一起用，我实在不明白这除了进一步消磨我的耐心有什么意义。更多时候是根本不知道要做什么。

剧情上，你可以说她是天马行空，我也可以说她是莫名其妙。那几个英文名不好记，而且我根本就不想记。陆陆续续强迫自己玩了好几章，现在还是看不懂一点，get不到一点快乐。反而是被所谓的游戏机制，干破防了。

游戏的出发点就是游戏性。而你这游戏玩起来没有一点乐趣，实在是不想强迫自己继续坐牢。表达艺术，方式要合理；既然你做的是面向大众的游戏，你就要考虑玩家实际游玩的感受，不然还是建议加上门槛。这游戏我游玩起来就是视觉加精神双重折磨。

说实话，作为一个游戏真的很失败。我不仅花钱了，还花了时间，得到的只有被恶心的经历、糟糕的心情和不堪回首的记忆。或许这游戏剧情真的有内核，但我真的是不愿再碰。

185800738.review:
Deux heures c'est tout, mais deux magnifiques heures. 
Ceci n'est pas qu'un jeu, c'est une expérience, une plongée intime dans les vies, souvenirs, secrets et les passions d'une famille. Chaque histoire m'a transporté dans un rêve éveillé, beau et mélancolique, où chaque détail, chaque son, et chaque image semblait me murmurer quelque chose d'universel sur la condition humaine. 

C'est une oeuvre qui ne se contente pas de raconter une histoire, mais qui te la fait ressentir, vivre, presque comme si elle faisait partie de toi. La plus-part même, me rappelaient des souvenirs d'enfance, comme quoi les moments les plus simples peuvent avoir une profondeur et une importance insoupçonnée.

Un chef-d'oeuvre narratif qui restera dans mon cœur pour longtemps après que l'écran ne soit éteint.

185704271.review: 游戏中文名《艾迪芬奇的记忆》，游戏中我们的主角翻开了母亲留给他的一本日记，我们将跟随母亲的视角一起探索一栋神秘的古宅和一个被诅咒的家族的故事。怀孕22周的Edith重回了Finch家族的大宅，寻找这个家族每任成员都会离奇死亡的秘密，在这栋古宅内，每一任成员都有一个专属的房间，我们跟随Edith的视角进入一个个锁起来的房间，通过房间的陈设或是房间里的其他物品，以及最重要的房间中的文本了解这些房间的主人经历过的事情。阅读这些文字的时候，我们会进入当事人的第一视角，回顾这些陈年往事。游戏总体分成了一段段小故事分布在一个个房间内，故事内容很精彩，或者说是奇幻，这更像一本奇幻冒险故事书，通过这些故事，我们能清晰了解到每一任成员的人物形象，性格。游玩时长约3小时，在月光的照耀下游玩过程总体透出一股淡淡的忧伤感，却又被各个房间的故事中和，显得恰到好处，使人内心平静。游戏不会缺乏引导，在前行过程中会出现一段段文字，在推进剧情的情况下也指明了前进的路。游戏全程都以第一视角进行，搭配上全程配音，代入感非常强。总体来讲，游玩这款游戏就像阅读了一本奇幻冒险书，故事精彩，游玩简单，代入感强，是不可多得的佳作。不过有点小遗憾的是，游戏中并没有明确说明家族受到诅咒的原因。

185701481.review: 非常精彩的关卡设计和视觉演出，虽然游戏总时长只有两个小时，但是内容非常丰富，沉浸感十足。

185699789.review:
在接触了这个游戏后，我制作独立游戏的想法愈发强烈！我想把我小的时候和现在那些天马行空的想象融入到游戏中，想和大家分享我的内心世界，有言道：“高山流水觅知音”，我希望我将来的游戏也为大家展示一个奇妙的世界，去寻一个知音，集合全世界所有灵魂共频的人，这想想都令人激动不是吗？当然我知道这个游戏的剧情是关于一个被诅咒的家族，如大家所见，我确实玩完了，我的文字绝非粘贴复制而来，而是内心最真实的情感。我想借鉴的是其中分段叙事时对每个人物如梦境和童话般的展现技术，我在玩的时候，像是进入了刘慈欣科幻小说《三体》中那个云天明的童话，国王加冕的部分尤甚。
所以我写下了这篇评论。

185696908.review:
出色的游戏体验，顶级的指引和交互，精湛的叙事技巧，因为实实在在地刻画了悲剧而变得纯粹，又因为对悲剧的戏谑而富有力量。 这是一个从一开始就已经结束了的故事，因为当故事被叙述出来的时候就已经结束了，聆听者走进了故事，就意味着叙述者早已走出了故事。但是亲爱的人啊，你不仅仅要走进别人的故事，你还要走进自己的故事，在自己的故事中里体验生活的乐趣、命运的无情，和死亡的残酷，还要在最后的时刻投以严肃的笑声。绝不要恐惧那种把自己想象成一个故事的能力，要知道，如果我们不曾带着惊异的目光看着生命，我们又怎能带着惊异的目光看着自己。

Lewis的段落正是对哈姆雷特那句名言的阐释——“即使把我关在一个果壳里，我也会把自己当作一个拥有无限空间的君王”。
默尔索刚入狱的时候，最叫他痛苦的便是自由人意识：“例如，我想到海滩上去，想朝大海走去，想像最先冲到我脚下的海浪的声响，想象身体跳进海水时的解脱感，这时，却突然意识到自己是紧闭在牢房的四壁之中。”但是很快，他就学会如何使用自己的记忆来压制监狱里的无聊：“有时，我回想我从前住过的房子，我想像自己从一个角落出发，在房间里走一圈又回到原处，心里历数在每一个角落里见到的物件。开始，很快就数完一遍。但我每来一遍，时间就愈来愈长。因为我回想起了每一件家具，每一件家具上陈设的每一件物品，每一件物品上所有的局部细节，如上面镶嵌着什么呀，有什么裂痕呀，边缘有什么缺损呀，还有涂的是什么颜色、木头的纹理如何呀，等等。同时，我还试着让我的清单不要失去其连贯性，试着不遗漏每一件物品。几个星期之后，单单是数过去房间里的东西，我一数就能消磨好几个钟头。这样，我愈是进行回想，愈是从记忆中挖掘出了更多的已被遗忘或当时就缺乏认识的东西。”
于是他领悟到：“一个人即使只生活过一天，他也可以在监狱里待上一百年而不至于难以度日，他有足够的东西可供回忆，决不会感到烦闷无聊。”记忆靠想象把过去的时间抓回自身，人因能够想象而身处危险之中，但也因为拥有想象而生活在有限的无限当中。这样，一日可以是永恒，永恒也只是一日。

185607920.review:
This was a fun walking sim to play.  However I had high hopes for What Remains of Edith Finch based on what others had said and I can say that I was let down.  Yes it has a good and engaging story, but it is far too short, only taking about 2 hours for me to complete.  It's not worth the $7 I paid on sale.

The first thing I'd like to compliment is the minigames, which I would say no two are that alike, and that all of the minigames actually contributed to the story (unlike some other games where the gameplay feels disconnected or just simply exists to say "hey we have a game here and not a movie")

I don't even know how to describe what narrative themes this game is trying to explore, but I love it.  It's an "interactive movie" game, meaning most of what you're doing is walking around and listening to narration.  But the story is intriguing from start to finish, and there's something so compelling about getting these little vignettes into a bunch of different characters lives, and seeing how everyone's experience is so different.

Maybe the narrative theme is "the parts of us we leave behind in other people when we die", I don't know.  But it's an [i]excellent[/i] game, and despite only playing for a few hours years ago, I still find myself thinking about some parts of the story to this day.

If you like short narrative-driven "interactive movie" games, this is not one to miss.

185449910.review:
Breve comentario con spoilers

¿Y qué queda de Edith Finch? ¿Quién es Edith Finch? ¿Quiénes son los Finch? Al menos al final, parecen quedar en principio dos cosas: ella y su hijo, y ambos a través de la historia que ella nos narra, que a su vez es la historia que va reconstruyendo de su familia. Y todo por una llave que le deja su madre. La vuelta a su hogar, en realidad, es la primera llegada. Al principio nos dice claramente que el lugar siempre le causó miedo, y que recién ahora puede nombrarlo. Pero también nos dice que llega por primera vez a algo que considera su casa.

A través de las innumerables muertes y vidas, o fragmentos de vidas, que nos iremos encontrando, podremos reconstruir la genealogía de algo que parece una tragedia griega con innumerables actos, pero que en realidad es algo que se vive con pasividad, sin esa exasperante lucha contra el destino que siempre termina siendo infructuosa. Nadie lucha, a excepción de la madre, que se resiste y protege a sus hijos como puede, y así los iremos viendo -primero a través de la mirilla de puertas infranqueables y después mediante sus cuadernos íntimos, también cerrados con llave- cómo todos van muriendo, incluso la protagonista. Cada fragmento de vida, un acto que conduce irremediablemente a la muerte. 

Algo que me llamó la atención es que en este relato jugable hay muchos niños que mueren. Y la muerte suele ser algo tabú cuando se trata de ellos. Con maestría y una enorme sensibilidad, se nos narran esas muertes, sin la necesidad de recurrir a recursos clásicos que expliciten demasiado. Creo que por esto no me parece casual que en los créditos se haya decidido incluir la foto de los desarrolladores cuando eran niños y no de adultos. 

Hay algo en la inocencia de ciertas muertes que es demoledor, pero quizá nada lo sea tanto como ir explorando y conociendo esta casa en un eterno estado de quietud. Son los ecos de una vida que está a punto de apagarse lo que escuchamos. Pero también -y sobre todo- los ecos de muchas vidas que ya se apagaron. Los ecos de un hogar que ya no es porque la muerte ha llegado a ocupar tantas habitaciones cerradas que ya lo ocupa todo. Esa quietud de las cosas, como esperando que las recuerden, que las cuenten, es el corazón de todo lo que se cuenta, porque no es solo la historia de los Finch, sino la de su casa a través de ellos, y viceversa. O la de sus casas: una, erguida ante el mar; la otra, semisumergida -debido al naufragio de uno de sus familiares- cerca de la orilla, lo suficiente como para que apenas se asome algo de ella, recordando que es otra parte de más de la casa, de la historia de la familia.

185444868.review:
[h1] A masterpiece of storytelling. [/h1]

This is not just a game—it’s an experience, a hauntingly beautiful dive into the lives, loves, and losses of a cursed family. Rarely does a game touch the depths of human emotion as this one does, weaving storytelling and gameplay into a poignant tapestry of memory and mystery.

From the moment you step into the Finch family home, the atmosphere grips you. The house itself feels alive, each room a lovingly detailed snapshot of a life cut short. As Edith, the last of the Finches, you uncover the stories of your relatives, each narrative told through unique and innovative gameplay mechanics that reflect the personality and fate of its subject. Whether it’s the joy and innocence of childhood or the despair of adult struggles, every vignette is a masterclass in empathy and immersion.

What truly sets [i] What Remains of Edith Finch [/i] apart is its ability to make you feel deeply connected to characters you meet for only a brief moment. It’s a game about life and death, about the legacies we leave behind, and about finding meaning in the fleeting nature of existence. It doesn’t shy away from difficult emotions, yet it never feels exploitative or gratuitous.

The music, visuals, and voice acting all come together to create a world that feels achingly real and heartbreakingly surreal. Each family member’s story resonates in its own way, lingering long after you’ve put down the controller.

This is a game that reminds us why storytelling matters, why the small moments in life are worth cherishing, and why video games are an art form. [i] What Remains of Edith Finch [/i] is not just a tale of tragedy but a celebration of the human spirit. It’s a game that will stay with you, like the memory of a loved one, long after the credits roll.

185363422.review:
I had to sleep on this game to really have an opinion on it.

And there's not much I can say either while staying spoiler-free. What Remains of Edith Finch is a walking sim so it's primarily story-focused. It has an interesting plot premise, and I do think it's really dark at times. I also think the game excels at getting the vibe of a dark atmosphere right. There are no jumpscares in this game and despite being told that there weren't beforehand, I still felt like one was coming. Which is a testament to them nailing the feeling of this old, creepy house.

Walking sims are in a weird space design-wise. Some walking sims are too vague in their themes and/or don't really justify their existence, which is the issue with them - Firewatch or Stray are great examples of that. I felt like I wasted my time with those games. I didn't get anything out of them.

There there are the walking sims that leave an impact because there's room for interpretation, even if they try to spell out their themes for you. Great examples are Journey and The Beginner's Guide. Beautiful games that really sit around in your brain afterwards because their themes were presented in a way that's memorable.

I bring these up because What Remains of Edith Finch, for me, is in a really weird middle ground between these two. While it's themes of death and being afraid of the weight of death are impactful, very clear to me, and I think it's told really well... I'm not leaving this game with anything in my opinion.

Maybe I've just been too desensitized to "dark"" content since I watch a lot of it on YouTube and etc - but the things this game portrays just don't hit for me? It's like, "Okay wow that's really dark. Moving on now..." I hope that makes sense. I don't see this game as being any different than hearing a disturbing story online. You hear this story and you move on with your day.

Which is the issue here because I'm not sure that What Remains of Edith Finch fully justifies its existence. This is a $20 game that's only 2 hours long. For comparison, Journey is $15 and The Beginner's Guide is only $10. Journey left me feeling something - feeling the sense of how people come and go through the cycle of life. The Beginner's Guide changed the whole way I look at critiquing games, and it on top of that supercharged my motivation so that I haven't been unmotivated ever since playing it.

What is What Remains of Edith Finch giving me? A dark story about death? I'm not getting anything from this other than a story told in an intuitive way, which is the issue here.

Walking Sims need to justify their existence and What Remains of Edith Finch doesn't totally do that - but it does do a lot of great things when it comes to atmosphere, intuitive storytelling, and visuals. It's a hard game to recommend to others, but I do think it's at the very least, good - I only wish it hit me a little more than it did.

Score: 82

A short dark walking simulator set in a house I would've loved to grow up in.

The story is fairly dark, but the strange dream-like sequences and gentle voice of the narrator make it an enjoyable one as well. All the different sub-stories are told by way of mini-game dream-like sequences which makes the whole journey interesting and enjoyable. And by mini-games I don't mean Wario Ware-style but actual miniature games that don't rely on 'skills' and are AFAIK impossible to fail.

The graphics are done in a style somewhere between comic book and realistic and are great,
It has that whole sort of Harry Potter urban fantasy feel to it.

The music, sound effects and voice-overs are all top notch.

I would wholeheartedly recommend this to any walking sim enthusiast or anyone looking for an interactive storybook/movie kind of thing. I would not recommend it to the average Call of Duty fan.

185132955.review:
A Hauntingly Beautiful Masterpiece of Storytelling

What Remains of Edith Finch is a breathtakingly emotional experience that showcases the power of storytelling in video games. It’s a game that combines stunning visuals, innovative gameplay, and deeply personal narratives to create an unforgettable journey through the lives of a family touched by tragedy.

The story revolves around Edith Finch, the last surviving member of the Finch family, as she returns to her ancestral home to uncover the stories of her relatives. Each chapter explores a different family member’s life and untimely death, told through unique and inventive gameplay sequences that perfectly reflect their personalities and experiences. From flying as a bird to working in a monotonous factory, every vignette is distinct, imaginative, and filled with emotional weight.

The writing is phenomenal, striking a balance between melancholy and wonder. The game explores themes of family, loss, and the inevitability of death with sensitivity and nuance, yet it also finds beauty in the fleeting moments of joy and creativity that define each character's life. It’s a deeply human story that feels universal despite its fantastical elements.

The visuals are stunning, with an incredible attention to detail that makes the Finch house feel like a character in its own right. The house is both eerie and inviting, filled with hidden secrets, personal mementos, and stories waiting to be discovered. Combined with the game’s excellent use of lighting and color, every scene feels like a work of art.

The soundtrack is equally memorable, with music that perfectly complements the tone of each story—be it whimsical, somber, or bittersweet. The voice acting is also top-notch, bringing Edith and her family’s stories to life with genuine emotion and authenticity.

At around 2-3 hours, What Remains of Edith Finch is a short game, but every moment is meaningful. It doesn’t overstay its welcome and leaves a profound emotional impact that lingers long after the credits roll.

If you enjoy narrative-driven games, What Remains of Edith Finch is an absolute must-play. It’s a beautiful, poignant, and deeply affecting experience that highlights the fragility of life and the stories we leave behind.

Uff, nach Beendigung dieses Spiels musste ich erstmal tief durchatmen.
Das Spiel als "Walking-Simulator" zu betiteln, wird diesem Meisterwerk nicht gerecht.
Die einzelnen Geschichten der Familienmitglieder waren (meistens) sehr berührend und wunderschön erzählerisch und grafisch dargestellt.

Ich kann das Spiel nur empfehlen und wäre im Nachhinein auch bereit, denn Vollpreis zu zahlen.

184907906.review:
***NOTE: While this game is great, and I definitely recommend it, there is unfortunately a game-breaking bug if you're playing on Mac Monterey with Parallels (it potentially also affects other Mac versions, but I haven't tried it). During Barbara's story, the game kept on crashing due to a video driver-related issue. The only way I was able to continue playing was to play on an actual PC.***

I came into this game thinking it would be an abstract, pretty-graphics walking simulator that was more for the visuals than for any story, but I was SO wrong. This game is SO much better (and deeper) than that. There is a genuinely interesting and quite complex story line with many twists and unexpected turns. You definitely won't be falling asleep while playing this game! 

The game crafts the narrative in a really unique and interesting way by having you explore the Finch house. More of the family's story is revealed as you progress through the house. It is said this family is cursed, and the story of each family member is how they met their demise. Each story is very unique and highly interactive--I was definitely caught off guard by some of them!

This game has easy achievements (2-3 out of 10 difficulty). Since you can replay each story after the game ends, none of the achievements are missable.

Overall, if you enjoy immersive, story-rich, interactive movie-type games that are fairly light on hardcore gameplay mechanics (i.e. you won't be killing enemies, you won't be trying to solve complex puzzles, there's basically just one path to take so you won't get lost--the focus is on the story and playing the game to reveal the story), then you'll love this game.

184826599.review:
Доброе утро/день/вечер/ночь.

Начнем с музыкального сопровождения - нормалды. Плакать не мешает.
Мне так нравится уютная обстановка в доме Финчей, что я могу кругами там ходить и разглядывать книжные полки. Хотя самой приятной мне показалась комната Льюиса.  Благодаря этому дед инсайду я собираюсь сделать себе неоновый светильник. Да и в целом, в данной игре действительно есть различные детальки, к которым можно заинтересованно приглядываться.

Лично я за проведенное время в игре несколько переосмыслила свое отношение к родословной. Иногда живешь, а не замечаешь что-то очень важное и тонкое, теплое и родное - родственную связь. А Эдит из-за определенных обстоятельств была лишена возможности говорить с родными людьми, и вынуждена одиноко бродить по старому дому в поисках истины. Но бродить с ней приятно, хоть периодически слезы льются из ушей.

Короче, мы полюбовались, подумали, порыдали. Добрая игра, значит.

I'm not really sure how to feel about What Remains of Edith Finch, but overall I think I loved it. The stories are masterfully told, and are really the main crutch of the game. I know a lot of people don't like these sort of 'walking simulators' but I don't mind them at all, and even then at some parts of the game your doing completely unique things (that I can't say because its tied to the story) so you always feel engaged with whatever is happening and don't feel like your just walking all the time. And speaking of whats happening it's telling the story of probably the most tragic family that's ever lived. I loved every single family member and what story they had to tell, but they we're all so sad. The implication of everything and how it ended got me pretty emotional, I honestly didn't really know what to do after I had played it, so I just went to bed and have it sit with me until I woke up. Honestly I didn't really feel any better about it but I could at least get a full understanding of the game, and like I said I began to love it.
What Remains of Edith Finch is undeniably going to leave an impression on you some way or another as it did for me, 8.5/10

184762039.review:
Je ne saurais décrire exactement ce qu'est la beauté, mais je la reconnais lorsque je la vois. Qu'est-ce que l'Art (avec un A majuscule) ? L'école de pensée "moderne" s'entend à dire que les dix arts sont:

1er art : l’architecture
2e art : la sculpture
3e art : les "arts visuels", soit la peinture, le dessin, la photographie et la gravure
4e art : la musique
5e art : la littérature, soit la poésie, les romans et tout ce qui se rattache à l'écriture
6e art : les "arts de la scène", soit la danse, le théâtre, le mime et le cirque
7e art : le cinéma
8e art : les "arts médiatiques", soit la radio et la télévision
9e art : la bande dessinée
10e art : les jeux vidéo et le multimédia

Personne ne s'entend pour savoir ce que serait le 11e. Hé! bien, pour tous ceux qui douteraient que le 10e art en est vraiment un, faites-les jouer à "What Remains of Edith Finch". En ~3h, les concepteurs de cette œuvre tissent une tapisserie de personnages attachants et vrais, et nous ouvrent une fenêtre sur leur âme.

Prenant, et totalement recommandé, même à plein prix.

184713412.review:
A story about family, memory, and grief. It manages to encapsulate its message beautifully in a form which is a combination of a unique narrative(that makes you belong to the story) and its general immersiveness, which only adds up to the feeling of involvement with how much dedication was put into making this game.

Each separate story gradually builds up to a certain high emotional point that is being almost immediately released with a simple quote at the end: "I know it's a lot to ask, but I don't want you to be sad that I'm gone. I want you to be amazed that any of us even had a chance to be here at all."

The difficult feelings that come with loss is what emerges as you progress further and further. We are being told not only of loss as of an event, but also of how it's processed, and of how differently. Suppression, avoidance, memorialization, and what we finally see as Edith — coming to terms with it, facing the difficult family history and the tensional burden weighted upon the generations of it for the sake of passing on the memory how things really were. It's also acknowledgement and acceptance as she does so, and yet [spoiler] understands the origins of the need to shield & protect her mother felt [/spoiler] .

And yet out of all of this, the existential "don't be sad when I'm gone" and the "I want you to be amazed that any of us even had a chance to be here at all" remain to be the things that have touched me the most.

When we're gone, the memory of us is all that remains. By making this journal, Edith has kept the long hidden memory for all of her close relatives. And herself. Thus, that's what remains of Edith Finch.

184597793.review:
What Remains of Edith Finch is just on another level. Every family member’s story is told in such a creative way—like one minute you’re flipping through a comic book, and the next you’re controlling a kite or daydreaming while working a boring cannery job. It’s wild how they make each story feel so unique but still connected.

The house itself? Man, it’s like a character on its own. All the weird rooms and secret passages make exploring so much fun, but it’s not just about that. It’s how every little thing you find hits you with emotions you didn’t even know were coming.

Honestly, this game isn’t just something you play—it’s something you feel. If you’re into deep, story-driven stuff or just want a game that stands out, this one’s a no-brainer. It’s easily one of the best experiences I’ve had in gaming.

One of my all Time favorites.
Its a bitter sweet story about coming back 'home' after everyone else is already gone, off looking back at memories as well as discovering new things. You explore the childhood home of the protagonist, while slowly uncovering whats happened to her family, combining her memories as a child with her discoveries now as an adult, entering rooms she was never before allowed to. Its a combination of exploring the house and its collection of sometimes unusual rooms and Minigames unfolding more of the story.
What Remains of Edith Finch isnt an extraordinary long game, but it is packed full of emotions and loving details, that leaves you longing to explore more and more until you've discovered every secret not only about Edith, but the whole Finch-Family.

184530663.review:
Antes de nada, es un "walking simulator" y la valoración va en referencia a este tipo de juegos. Si es un género que no te gusta o no es para ti, probablemente este juego no es para ti.

La duración es de unas 4 horas y es tan inmersivo que te lo juegas del tirón. Sigues la historia de una mujer de regreso a la casa familiar para descubrir sus secretos y, mediante estos, los trágicos pasados de todos lo que allí vivieron.

Tiene un tinte surrealista muy atractivo, el apartado artístico es sublime y mezcla varios géneros de manera ingeniosa. Logra transmitir nostalgia, y la casa se siente como si de verdad hubiese albergado muchas vidas en ella. La narración es bella y los textos de traducción al español están integrados en el paisaje, dándole un aspecto de cuento.

Los logros son pocos y sencillos de sacar. En caso de necesitarlo, al terminar el juego puedes repetir cualquiera de las historias de manera independiente, lo cual ayuda.

Recomendadísimo para quien disfrute los "walking simulator", las novelas visuales y las aventuras gráficas pausadas, sin puzles ni inventario.

184507605.review:
艺术性非常强的一款游戏。
家族成员的死亡真的可以大而化之地归因于诅咒吗？其实不然。家庭成员的漠视、生活的空虚和绝望、战争带来的悲剧，构成Finch Family的悲剧的一切因素可以视作一个时代的缩影和记忆。
---
Pros：
+ 神乎其神的叙述方式，每个家庭成员的故事都有其独有的设计和巧思。
+ 天马行空的想象力和不同视角对死亡历程的叙述，构成了本作的剧情特色。玩家可以在这些角色身上找到些许共鸣，并得到一些思考。

Cons：
- 本作的主要玩法为步行模拟器，是一款3D的“视觉小说”。叙事节奏慢，在花费几小时后只获取了少许信息量。不适合奔着“解开死亡谜团”来的解谜游戏爱好者。
- 艺术表现性远大于玩法，如果无法从本作中的感性表达中获取情绪价值（或者说被“触动”），那么单论玩法，本作对部分玩家而言会相当无聊。

---
最喜欢Lewis和Milton的故事。虽囿于现实生活的庸碌，但可在幻想世界称王。

184495421.review:
Edith Finch, I thought she is Bertrand Russell’s fourth wife. 
Nope. 
It’s a 2–3-hour long game that explains the death of 12 Finch family members, because of bad parenting, reckless decision making, and unfortunate tragic circumstances. Finch is a Norwegian American family that built its family cemetery first, even before their new house – only one within a generation gets to live.
According to the development team, they got a bunch of brilliant mini game ideas and was going to make it a scenario that is similar to The Canterbury Tales. Basically puzzled up those ideas together into a family tree, then mapped out the whole story.
That explains why there are tons of very creative ideas in this game. However, the whole emotion is sad and depressed. Can’t it be designed with a happy game setting like It Takes Two? Big rich families have mental health issues, and their kids die young. What a tragedy! 
To name a couple of brilliant game-plays - Barbara’s story was told within comic book pages, and Lewis’ fantasy world amazed my multiple times regards to its storytelling and keyboard controls. 
Soon or later, there will be another studio picking up one or two cool game ideas out of this game and make it into a new jolly happy game.

184426193.review:
What Remains of Edith Finch é um jogo eletrônico de aventura desenvolvido pela Giant Sparrow e publicado pela Annapurna Interactive para Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4 e Xbox One em 2017, e para Nintendo Switch em 2019.
Gráficos e Design Visual:
O jogo é em primeira pessoa e possui bons gráficos. O design do mundo é bem construído, com bons detalhes que fazem o jogador mergulhar no universo de What Remains of Edith Finch. Embora os gráficos não sejam o elemento principal do jogo, eles não são extraordinários, mas estão longe de serem ruins. São gráficos bons.
Jogabilidade e Controles:
What Remains of Edith Finch é um jogo de aventura focado na narrativa. Como Edith, o jogador explora a casa dos Finch e o deserto ao redor através de uma série semi-linear de salas, trilhas, rasteiras e passagens secretas. A narração de Edith guia o jogador, fornecendo comentários sobre seus próprios pensamentos, experiências e relações com cada personagem. Os controles são simples, mas bem divertidos. Com o mouse, o jogador precisa fazer movimentos conforme os objetos solicitam. Gostei bastante da jogabilidade e dos controles de What Remains of Edith Finch. (editado)

História e Narrativa:
O jogo centra-se no personagem de Edith Finch, última na linhagem da família Finch, que tem uma maldição percebida que faz com que todos, exceto um membro de cada geração, morram de maneiras incomuns. Edith voltou para a casa de sua família na costa do estado de Washington após a morte de sua mãe, para explorar a casa que eles abandonaram apressadamente anos antes. Ela aprende sobre seus parentes e suas mortes, visitando seus quartos, fechados e tratados como santuários à sua memória, com cada morte retratada em uma curta sequência de jogo para o jogador. O jogo é apresentado como uma antologia dessas mini-experiências, envolto na narrativa dramática da história da família e do destino, através da narração de Edith. A história é confusa no começo; você não sabe por que está ali, quem é Edith, mas conforme sua narrativa, você vai entendendo a história e ficando cada vez mais curioso sobre por que os personagens morreram dessa forma, quem são eles e onde estão os outros quartos. O jogo apresenta vários personagens, cada um diferente do outro, mas são histórias bem contadas que prendem o jogador ao jogo. Este jogo me surpreendeu muito. (editado)

Impacto Geral e Conclusão:
Como mencionei anteriormente, este jogo me surpreendeu muito. Sua narrativa e história são perfeitas, e o áudio e a trilha sonora também estão de parabéns. What Remains of Edith Finch foi bem recebido pela crítica especializada, que elogiou sua história e apresentação, e é considerado um exemplo de jogos eletrônicos como uma forma de arte. Venceu o prêmio de Melhor Jogo de 2017 na British Academy Games Awards e ganhou na categoria de "Melhor Narrativa" no The Game Awards 2017 e Game Developers Choice Awards, entre outros prêmios e indicações. Eu recomendo fortemente que vocês joguem What Remains of Edith Finch, um jogo que me surpreendeu. Vou dar uma nota mais alta do que a do público e a dos críticos, mas para mim é justa.

Nota: 8.5/10

184378812.review:
Rating: 10/10.
I cried.
I'm not a professional critic or whatever, but this may genuinely be the most beautiful story I've ever experienced. The entire presentation is just wonderful.
I played this game on a very mediocre laptop, but it still ran well. While it may not have any *interesting* mechanics outside of the stories, it doesn't need to be. Every mechanic it needs is already there. All you have to do is walk ant interact.
It's the most impactful game I've ever played. The entire game can he described in one sentence. "You are a 17 teen year old revisiting your childhood after your mom passes away, and you're unraveling your family's secrets." It's not a bad thing that you can describe it in one sentence, it's quite a good thing. It's only a two hour game, but it's more impactful than any movie I've watched. 
A reviewer said something along the lines of "why not just watch someone stream it?". It's so *you* can experience it. There is a difference between experiencing and watching a YouTuber play it. 

SPOILERS:
||The most impactful stories to me are Lewis' and Walter's.||
||Lewis is the final death you get to experience. Lewis was a cannery worker. After stopping substance abuse, he realizes the mundaneness of his day to day life and his mind begins to wander. You play as both the real Lewis and the imagination. At the very end of his story, you go up to be crowned king by the prince/princess of your choosing. As you place your head down, you get beheaded. Lewis committed suicide. This is all described by his therapist to Lewis' mother in a note, and even she can understand why he did it.||
||Walter's was also very impactful for a kind of similar reason to Lewis'. After witnessing the death of his sister Barbara, he became a shut in, living under the house. As the years go by of him staying in the basement, he gets used to the train, thinking it's the physical manifestation of the family's curse. One day, the train stops coming. After a week, he decides he's going to leave the basement. He breaks down the wall and walks along the train track, and the train comes, killing him.||

184294621.review:
TLDR: A really good game about grief and loss, 10/10, a short game that anyone can jump into and enjoy. It's truly a "story" game first. 

A lot of games, especially renown for their story struggle between the game part and the story part of the game. Some sacrifice storytelling for gameplay, some sacrifice gameplay for story, and some lets you find the story and let you play the game for yourself. This game doesn't sacrifices anything, it's a well made game with everything where the devs want it. It's a perfectly crafted experience from start to finish, it KNOWS its playtime, it KNOWS the story it tells, and doesn't play around with it past that. 

It's one of the few gaming experiences where it's an example of a perfectly crafted story made for its medium, it isn't one you could write a book about, it isn't one where you can make a movie about it either. To uncover the mysteries of the Finch family is so odd, but bringing things to light with how unfortunate this family is. How regular death is in the family, it somehow doesn't consume anyone but the mother. It becomes stories, tales, myths, comics, and tragedies, all lessons but all of the Finch's move on in their own ways.

Seeing the stories through their eyes, how they cope with loss through isolation, stardem, or stories, is so refreshing. It's sad, it's dark, but it's lighthearted. It doesn't drop your heart into the floor, it doesn't scare you, it doesn't make you fear death. At the end of it all, each story it tells through said member of the family is unique to each and is beautiful in their own ways. It's an experience like no others, a game that properly combines story telling and gameplay to craft an experience only games can tell. 

This is mostly rambling, I just finished it and I'm contemplating all the meanings of life and whatever. But I truly, whole heartedly recommend this game. This game has love put into it, it's so genuine in telling us the stories of the Finch family. It's so short, but it tells a story like no other, that no other medium can tell. Try it out, it's a deal at any price.

184087191.review:
Playtime: ~4 hours

What Remains of Edith Finch isnt just a game, its an experience. From the very first moments, I was completely immersed in its world. The storytelling is unmatched, weaving together a series of deeply personal, emotional, and sometimes haunting tales.

What makes this game so special is the way it uses gameplay to tell its stories. Each segment feels unique, with mechanics that perfectly fit the tone and theme of the characters story. Its hard to pick a favorite moment because every part adds something unforgettable to the whole experience.

The art style and music are stunning, creating an atmosphere thats equal parts melancholic and beautiful. Even though the game is short, it left a lasting impression on me, and I keep thinking about it long after finishing.

If you havent played What Remains of Edith Finch, you are missing out on one of the most heartfelt and creative games ever made.

Rating: 10/10

184080775.review:
Words flying in the book, another me in my mind, and daydreaming has been haunting me since my childhood. I went to doctor, but all they said is lack of concentration or ADHD, which I knew is definitely misdiagnosis, but I just could not describe the concoction in my brain. After that, I denied all kinds of treatment, met classmates with similar syndromes, and fell deeper and deeper into the quagmire.

I failed to distinguish between imagination and reality. I started hearing words no one ever said, blanking out during the class, noticing new iron fences getting rusty and ivy leaves climbing over the wall everywhere. Later, my mom found out that my dad, actually also my grandpa, has some kind of delusion of persecution. In the end, she brutally cut my connection with my parental relatives and make me transfer to another school.

At that time, I hated her so much since I had no friend or anyone familiar to talk with. But later, my hallucination became alleviated, as I finally met normal people, normal teachers, normal friends and girlfriend. However, I still didn't know what is inside my head, and I didn't even dare to touch alcohol in case I cannot control my delusion.

Things changed after this game. Instead of just a story, the whole Edith Finch legacy is more like a mirror of my mind. I have never seen anyone depicting my thoughts so vividly - switching between animals, daydreaming in the cannery, etc. After years I eventually can view myself objectively and know why my mom did that. Without her, I might still stuck in the unreality and could have ended badly.

For those suffer as I did, do not hesitate to seek help. But please remember, the thing you are afraid of isn't going to end when you leave the house. The only way to conquer it, is to know who you are, and face what it is.

184080376.review:
A gripping short story that weaves a tale of loss, acceptance and remembrance. It is an emotional story driven game that demonstrates the potential that video games as a media have to to tell stories.  It puts you in the shoes of edith finch, a girl that's exploring her family's history and the story of each finch member. The house you explore is hand crafted and full of details that expresses it's rich history and the life each family member had on the house. 
The voice acting is well done, the art style is incredible and the story is great. Be warned however, that this game is a walking simulator, where you simply walk from point a to point b to interact with something, it is more like a interactive  movie then a game. If you are fine with that then this is a must play.

184027907.review:
What Remains Of Edith Finch——
温馨与孤独的悲剧，最接近第九艺术的神级叙事。
在推进游戏进程中，需要触碰每个人的生活物件，逐渐走进死者的过去，无法抗拒地跟随镜头，一步一步地、走向死亡。艺术性的死亡模拟器，沉浸式的体验家族中的每个人死亡的那一天，大家都死在了自己不甘平凡的、斑斓的日子里。
最震撼的还是Lewis自毁式死亡，在机械的流水线工厂工作中丧失自主意识，只愿在幻想的世界寻找自己的价值，在虚假的仪式中戴上皇冠授得加冕的那一刻，他告诉自己“低下头”，将自己送上现实世界中罐头厂的断头台。左右画面穿插，左边是Lewis幻想的美好游戏世界，右边重复枯燥乏味且血腥的断鱼头工作，冷暖色碰撞，画面冲击极大。且在这一游戏流程需要机械且重复性的砍鱼头操作，而精神思绪却随着Lewis的船帆投入幻想世界，这种精神分裂的游戏感诠释得太奇妙了。
中途换场景时印象很深的是，大家的墓碑上都是自己生前最喜欢的事物，温馨的物品最终留在冰冷的石碑上。玩完游戏仿佛看了一场以“悲伤”为主题的电影，最后游戏定格也只留下了孤独的Edith的孩子，家族中真正的最后一人。但它想要讲述的似乎不只是悲伤，就如同死亡也从来不是一个只含乎悲伤的话题。走进每个人的精神世界，会发现大家都是一样的鲜活，有自己的梦想有不同的喜好，Babara即使失意也仍想重新成为明星、Calvin荡着秋千想着航天、Sam经历丧子之痛后仍在打猎时对Dawn说出“如果你想生存，你需要变得强大”这种对生活充满勇气与信念的话语。所有人的结局都是已知的，但或许作者让我们体验其过程的意义就在于，不要忘记曾经鲜活的那些日子，到头来都只是各自的旅途，仅此。

人生天地间，忽如远行客。
亦如逆旅，你我亦是行人。

非常推荐的好游戏！如果你把电子游戏当成一种艺术表达的手段，或是一种流行文化，这款游戏可以说是必玩的。
剧情上是悬疑的基调，讲述了Finch家族的一代代人或真或假，似梦似幻的死亡情景。每个人的小线索相互穿插，整体融会贯通，游玩体验非常棒。操作难度很低、游玩时长也不长，所以推荐慢慢游玩，这游戏很多巧思都在细节上。
这款游戏最让我印象深刻的一点，是像阿甘正传一样，随着剧情推进，展示了一代代美国流行文化的演变。[spoiler] 剧情最后，Edie向2024年，屏幕前的玩家说到“But I don't want you to be sad that I'm gone. I want you to be amazed that  any of us ever had chance to be here at all.” 我想这样理解，并不要为某种流行文化的落寞甚至是死亡而悲伤，翻页书被漫画取代，漫画又被游戏取代，总有人正在年轻，总有文化形式正在流行。欣赏，惊叹，不必悲伤。[/spoiler]

183918764.review:
"What Remains of Edith Finch" might be the most genuinely heartbroken I have been with a game in a long time. This game is so beautiful and well worth the "Overwhelmingly Positive" review score. I knew a little bit of the plot prior to playing, but to actually experience it first hand is a completely different experience. While it is just a "walking simulator" and the actual "gameplay" is mostly limited to turning the mouse/joystick in certain directions to open a door or fly a kite, the story and atmosphere are well worth experiencing. I recommend that if you are even the least bit interested to pick it up. Even if you are privy to a few of the story lines like I was, you will probably still be surprised at how simultaneously heartbreaking and heartwarming this game can still be. 

TW: allusions to suicide/mental illness, allusions to child death. This game is about grief and the importance of dealing with it in a healthy manner, so there is a LOT of death in this game. Nothing is "on-screen" but these deaths are very heavily hinted at. One character drowns, for example, but it is is first-person POV and there is no "struggle", noises, or visuals. Rather, once the water fills the screen, it cuts away.

183829649.review:
This is not a typical game; it’s more like stepping into a beautifully crafted story about family, loss, and memories. You explore the Finch family home, a place full of history and secrets. Every corner reveals a new story.

The unique storytelling makes this experience special. You learn about each family member’s life and final moments through short, self-contained narratives. Each story feels different, with its own visual style and way of interacting, so it never gets boring. This approach is very clever.

At its core, the game is about family connections, the pain of losing loved ones, and how our memories shape us. It thoughtfully explores these important themes. The gameplay focuses on exploring the house and experiencing the stories. However, the captivating writing and atmosphere make you forget about more traditional gameplay.

It handles sensitive topics with care, creating a strong emotional experience that stays with you. If you appreciate games for their stories and emotional depth, this is one you should definitely play. You won’t forget it.

183823037.review:
¡Oh, nobles almas que en vuestro afán por entender las cosas del mundo os aproximáis a estas palabras, escuchad con atención lo que a continuación se ha de contar, pues en la historia que os traigo se encierra un relato de destinos aciagos, de tragedias perdidas en el abismo del tiempo, y de una joven dama que, cual sombra errante, se aventura en un hogar antiguo y lleno de secretos olvidados! Hablo de What Remains of Edith Finch, un relato que surge de las tinieblas de la fatalidad y el olvido, de una familia cuyo linaje ha sido marcado por la desgracia, y cuya mansión, cual morada de los antiguos fantasmas, guarda en sus muros los ecos de aquellos que ya no se hallan entre los vivos.

En tiempos lejanos, cuando los hombres aún luchaban contra dragones y monstruos en tierras desoladas, la familia Finch vivió en una mansión que se alzaba en un rincón olvidado del mundo, rodeada de bosques oscuros y montañas que susurraban con voces antiguas. Mas, ¡oh!, no creáis que esta familia vivió en paz o prosperidad, pues el destino, cual cruel señor, les deparó un fin lamentable, y la sombra de la muerte siempre estuvo al acecho, reclamando uno tras otro a los miembros de esta desdichada estirpe. Y así, con el pasar de los años, aquellos que quedaban en la mansión se veían arrastrados por las mismas corrientes de maldad que habían cegado a sus ancestros.

En esta triste crónica, la figura de Edith Finch, la hija de una familia perdida en el caos del destino, se levanta como la última heredera, la única que se atreve a regresar a la mansión ancestral para descubrir los oscuros misterios que la habitan. En su viaje hacia las ruinas de su hogar, Edith no solo se enfrenta a las ruinas materiales de la casa, sino a las ruinas del alma misma, pues cada rincón de aquella morada está impregnado con las huellas de los que se han ido. Y, a cada paso que da, la joven Edith se ve transportada al pasado, a los recuerdos de aquellos que cayeron, uno tras otro, víctimas de los designios crueles que los dioses les impusieron.

¡Oh, qué extraño es este relato, en verdad!, pues no se cuenta como las historias de caballeros y reyes, ni como las gestas de héroes de antiguas crónicas. En What Remains of Edith Finch, las historias son como sueños rotos, fragmentos de vidas que se deshacen como polvo al viento. Cada miembro de la familia Finch tiene su propia historia, un relato de vida y muerte que se despliega como las antiguas leyendas de los pueblos perdidos. Y, sin embargo, estas historias no se cuentan de manera directa, sino que se revelan a través de los ojos de Edith, quien, como una peregrina en busca de respuestas, se adentra en cada habitación de la mansión, cada rincón de la morada, descubriendo los ecos de aquellos que ya no habitan este mundo.

Cada uno de los miembros de la familia Finch, antes de su destino final, dejó tras de sí una huella, una historia que se desvela en los más oscuros pasajes de la casa. Estos relatos no son como los que se cuentan en las tabernas o en los banquetes de los nobles, sino como los susurros que flotan en el aire, como las sombras que se mueven en los rincones olvidados. En cada habitación, en cada objeto, en cada rincón de la mansión, Edith encuentra la memoria de los que se fueron, y con ello la sensación de que el tiempo no ha sido misericordioso con su familia.

Mas, ¡oh! qué oscuros son los caminos que la joven Edith ha de recorrer, pues no solo se enfrenta a las sombras del pasado, sino también a la revelación de que su propia vida está atada a la maldición de los Finch, que, como una rueda que gira sin cesar, sigue su curso imparable. La mansión misma, con sus paredes que crujen como si hablaran, parece un símbolo de los recuerdos que no pueden morir, de las almas que no hallan descanso, y de la perpetua lucha entre la vida y la muerte.

Y así, mientras Edith recorre las habitaciones desmoronadas, descubre que en cada uno de los relatos de los Finch hay algo más que tragedia: hay belleza, hay amor, hay una humanidad que no puede ser despojada incluso por el destino más cruel. Cada historia de muerte, cada caída trágica, es un reflejo de lo que queda después de que el tiempo ha pasado, de lo que se conserva cuando todo lo demás se ha desvanecido en las brumas del olvido.

En What Remains of Edith Finch, la muerte no es un final absoluto, sino una transición, un paso hacia lo que permanece, hacia lo que se conserva en el alma y en los recuerdos. Y en este relato de la joven Edith, la verdad no es algo que se pueda alcanzar de forma sencilla, sino algo que se descubre solo a través de la pérdida, solo a través de la comprensión de lo que se ha ido y lo que se ha dejado atrás. Y así, la joven Edith, cual heroína perdida en la niebla del tiempo, sigue su camino, sabiendo que la verdad que busca tal vez no le dé el consuelo que anhela, sino la comprensión de que las sombras nunca se disipan por completo.

Así pues, si alguna vez os halláis en la senda de esta crónica, recordad que What Remains of Edith Finch no es solo un juego de tragedia y misterio, sino una reflexión sobre la naturaleza del tiempo, de la muerte y de lo que queda cuando todo se ha ido. Y en la búsqueda de Edith, como en todas las grandes historias de antaño, la victoria no es un premio tangible, sino una comprensión profunda de los misterios del alma humana, esos que no pueden ser desvelados sin antes haber sido vividos, perdidos y llorados.

183631806.review:
"[i]That night a lot of things came back to me... or maybe I came back to them.[/i]" - Edie Finch

This game... I mean words cannot describe how this affected me. The concept of Edith retelling everyone's story is not only unique but also profoundly moving. Each narrative is not only diverse in its struggles, but also gameplay. As you progress, the weight of the Finch family begins to feel almost tangible in a sense.

I have not forgotten about the visuals and music though. Both of these elements harmonize well together and enhance the games theme of loss. There's an unsettling ambiance that seems to follow you through each corner of the dilapidated house. At the same time, the game's melancholic undertones add a yearning of regret that touches your soul.

This game is [i]the[/i] embodiment of art. All of its mechanics are beautifully crafted to provide a deeply emotional experience that does not disappoint. It truly redefined what a 'game' is and what it could become. 

This game deals with many sensitive topics but I believe that is what we need. We've become too desensitized... too lost. We [i]need[/i] to wake up. Ultimately, this game provided me with a question that has been lingering in my mind: Why must we endure all these trials just to be forgotten?

We are zombies obscured in chaos and the unpredictability of life. Is it wrong to think that I might meet the same fate as Molly, Odin, Calvin, Barbara, Walter, Sam, Gregory, Gus, Milton, Lewis, Edie, Dawn, or Edith?

What is the meaning to it all... [i]is there any meaning?[/i]

183603025.review:
You know- besides the whole being born all over again I'd say this game is really rather awesome. Totally *did not* make me cry. Nuhuh. Not me, no. 

I first saw this game on a stream two-three years ago and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since then.

The stories about every member of the Finch family's life and death were so well written and the visuals? Don't even get me started on the visuals. I could seriously both talk day and night about how well designed f the game is and also be at a complete loss for words. The game has a beautiful way of steering you through the story, making you pay attention while also allowing you watch the scenery without missing details.

As an artist who deals with some issues I cannot say how much Milton's story affected me. Like actually. It's uh- great? I suppose you could say. Idk. It's a lot, that's for sure. Made me feel a lot, and that's saying something. Made me tear up in less than a minute, and I don't even usually cry over stuff.

If you have the time and money, and for some reason have scrolled far enough to find this mess of a review, you might as well buy the game. It's beautiful and heart touching while also chokingly sad. It is worth every minute of your time.

183535850.review:
What remains of my emotions? Mostly perplexity but in a good way.

I was told What Remains of Edith Finch is an emotional game, but maybe I process things differently. Instead of feeling sad, I found myself deeply perplexed by what happened to the Finch family. Without going into spoilers, the game feels more like a mystery that's open to interpretation.

The game is fairly short, taking around 2 hours or less to complete depending on how thorough you are. The mechanics are simple, which makes it easy to focus on the narrative and the atmosphere. The visuals are absolutely stunning, and the soundtrack complements the storytelling perfectly.

While I don’t see myself replaying it anytime soon (I tend to get bored revisiting games too soon), I know I’ll return to it in a few months. Knowing the full story now, I’m sure I’ll discover new layers or reflect on the experience in a different way during a second playthrough.

If you enjoy narrative-driven games that make you think, this one is worth your time.

183520694.review:
[h1]Un voyage inoubliable à travers la mémoire, la tragédie et la beauté de la vie[/h1]

What Remains of Edith Finch n’est pas simplement un jeu vidéo, c’est une œuvre d’art, une expérience profondément personnelle qui vous happe et vous marque à jamais. Dès les premières minutes, on est transporté dans cette maison gigantesque et chaotique, un personnage à part entière, chargée d’histoires, de mystères et de souvenirs. C’est un endroit où le passé semble vivant, où chaque pièce, chaque détail raconte une partie de l’histoire tragique des Finch.

Ce qui rend ce jeu si unique, c’est la manière dont il mêle narration et gameplay ; chaque chapitre dédié à un membre de la famille est raconté d’une façon différente, avec des mécaniques de jeu adaptées qui rendent chaque expérience inoubliable. Une balade en cerf-volant qui devient une lutte contre une tragédie intérieure, une plongée dans une bande dessinée d’horreur saisissante, ou encore une rêverie onirique qui juxtapose banalité et grandeur… Ces moments sont d’une créativité folle et parviennent à transmettre des émotions intenses, sans jamais être forcés ou artificiels.

Mais derrière cette beauté se cache une tristesse omniprésente. La famille Finch semble être prisonnière d’une malédiction inexorable, et malgré les instants magiques, le poids du destin se fait ressentir à chaque pas. La narration est si subtilement maîtrisée qu’on ne peut s’empêcher de se sentir connecté à chacun des personnages, même si on ne passe que quelques minutes dans leur univers.

Et puis, il y a la fin. Cette conclusion douce-amère m’a frappée de plein fouet. C’est à la fois une célébration de la vie et une méditation sur sa fragilité, sur ce que nous laissons derrière nous, et sur les souvenirs que d’autres porteront. Une fin si incroyablement triste qu’elle m’a laissé les larmes aux yeux (q_q), mais aussi un sentiment de gratitude pour avoir vécu cette aventure.

What Remains of Edith Finch est une œuvre à part, le genre d’expérience que l’on porte en soi longtemps après y avoir joué. Si vous cherchez une histoire qui ne se contente pas de divertir, mais qui touche à l’âme, foncez. Vous serez à la fois émerveillé et brisé, mais ça en vaut tellement la peine !!!

[quote]8.5/10[/quote]
